node.title: With half its staff in isolation, Katherine's only major supermarket has slashed opening hours during lockdown
node.description: Katherine's Woolworths — the town's only major supermarket — is struggling to keep its doors open, with half its staff in isolation as the COVID crisis in the town continues.
node.content:
["Katherine's only major supermarket is struggling to keep its doors open, with half its staff in isolation as the COVID crisis in the town continues.\u00a0", "The Woolworths store is one of more than a dozen exposure sites in the town of around 10,000 people, where more COVID cases in the Katherine and Robinson River cluster were confirmed today.", "The store's opening hours have been reduced from\u00a07am to 10pm to\u00a09am to 5pm.\u00a0", "In a statement, a Woolworths\u00a0spokesperson said the cluster and exposure site declarations\u00a0had affected a large percentage of its staff.\u00a0", "\"As a consequence, we don't have enough team members available to operate our normal trading hours and full in-store offering,\" the spokesperson said.\u00a0", "\"We understand this is frustrating and regret the impact it is having on our customers.", "\"The wellbeing of our customers, team and community is our highest priority, and in line with public health advice, we are taking all necessary steps to support safety in our stores.\"", "A spokesperson said online orders at the store had\u00a0been \"paused\".", "A staff member at Katherine Woolworths said the service was booked out until at least Saturday.\u00a0", "Anyone who visited Katherine Woolworths on November 13 between 3pm and\u00a04pm, and from 5:35pm to 6pm, are considered casual contacts and must get tested immediately.\u00a0", "The same direction applies to anyone who visited the supermarket on November 12 between 5pm and 6pm, on November 3 from 4:55pm to 5:30pm, and November 1 from 6:30pm to 6:50pm.", "The full list of all current NT public exposure sites\u00a0can be found on the NT government's coronavirus\u00a0website.", "", "
More than a dozen exposure sites have been listed in Katherine.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "There are now 19\u00a0cases in the Katherine and Robinson River community cluster.", "At a press conference on Wednesday, NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner said authorities had so far\u00a0identified 234 close contacts, including 31 at Robinson River.", "Authorities are still yet to reach 127\u00a0close contacts.\u00a0", "At today's press conference, NT Chief Minister Michael\u00a0Gunner said the contact tracing effort had \"hit some quick sand\" around a key exposure site,\u00a0with health workers unable to identify dozens of people who signed into a popular pub on the town's main street.", "\"We know of about 66 close contacts at Kirby's Pub, however, our contact tracers\u00a0have not been able to effectively capture everyone who has checked in because of missing or illegible information,\" he told reporters.\u00a0", "\"The hard copy register at Kirby's is largely illegible. This puts us behind the eight ball.", "\"Please don't omit information such as your contact number. We are asking you to do this so we can tell you to get tested as soon as possible, otherwise it may be too late.\"", "
Business owners brace for impact
", "Adding to concerns in Katherine is the recent extension of the lockdown from three to seven days.", "Trent de With, who runs a fishing tackle shop, said businesses and their staff would need financial assistance to get through the latest lockdown, but were yet to hear from the government if there were any plans for that.", "\"We've got Christmas coming up, so we've geared up with a whole heap of stock, and I've got to pay those bills in a week or two, and I've got no income coming in to pay those bills,\" he said.", "\"The financial toll, the stress on my mind [and] mental health \u2026 it takes a really big toll.", "\"Without a week's worth of income, it's a scary time for their staff and the owners.\"", "Prior to the recent lockdown, many Katherine business owners said they were already concerned about financial stability\u00a0due to the NT government's COVID vaccine mandate.\u00a0", "Last week, they told the ABC they expected staff shortages would likely impact services in remote communities, and that some bosses were considering recruiting staff from overseas to fill the roles of unvaccinated workers.", "", "
WA's COVID-19 reopening roadmap
"]
